course.title: Kant's Critique of Pure Reason
course.description: A careful reading of the work that is the cornerstone of Kant's critical system, his first Critique, aiming at a general understanding of the problems that Kant seeks to address and the significance of his doctrine of "transcendental idealism." Topics to include: the role of mind in the constitution of experience; the nature of space and time; the relation between self-knowledge and knowledge of objects; causation; freedom of the will; the relation between appearance and reality; the status of metaphysics.
